snippet: Najia Sediqi, the acting head of women’s affairs in Laghman Province, was the second woman in that post to be killed in less than six months.
abstract: Najia Sediqi, acting head of women's affairs in Laghman Province, Afghanistan, is shot to death in daylight as she is traveling to work; it is second time in less than six months that person holding that post has been assassinated.

byline.original: By ALISSA J. RUBIN and HABIB ZAHORI
byline.contributor: An employee of The New York Times contributed reporting from Jalalabad, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: Najia Sediqi, the acting head of women’s affairs in Laghman Province, was the second woman in that post to be killed in less than six months.

headline.seo: Afghan Women’s Affairs Official Assassinated by Gunmen
headline.main: Afghan Women’s Affairs Aide Shot Months After Killing of Predecessor
headline.print_headline: Afghan Women’s Affairs Aide Shot Months After Killing of Predecessor
